thread.title: Louvre suspect 'posted pro-ISIS messages on Twitter' | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Louvre suspect 'posted pro-ISIS messages on Twitter' | Daily Mail Online

author: Dave Burke For Mailonline
title: Louvre suspect 'posted pro-ISIS messages on Twitter' | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad Pictured: Louvre suspect who 'posted pro-ISIS messages on Twitter moments before he attacked four soldiers outside Paris art gallery' A man armed with a machete was shot five times in the stomach after attempting to storm the museum Police source said the attacker was shouting 'Allahu Akbar' before being gunned down The suspect has been named as Abdallah El Hamahmy, a 29 year old Egyptian national French Prime Minister Bernard Cazeneuve has described the attack as 'terrorist in nature'
